main event: A civilian woman observed a large orange object that took on a white edge and moved rapidly out of sight over Washington D.C.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 2 minutes., The object was larger than the moon and was seen at 0015 AM on August 1, 1952., The object was described to glide slowly with a pointed end extending upward at an angle., A sailor and others confirmed seeing a large orange object, which remained motionless before disappearing., The sightings were attributed to possibly being a balloon or astronomical in nature.
witness description: Mrs. [REDACTED] and Mr. [REDACTED], residents of Washington D.C.
